content:
Diagnosis
	1. High grade serous carcinoma of fallopian tube with omental metastases
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Diagnostic laparoscopy and biopsy

	Chemotherapy
	1. Carboplatin/Paclitaxel - 3 cycles completed March 2024
	2. Bevacizumab maintenance commenced April 2024

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease

	Current issues
	1. Increasing abdominal pain and distension
	2. Deteriorating performance status
	3. Symptomatic ascites requiring drainage

	Summary of consultation
	I reviewed [redacted name] today who attended with her daughter. Unfortunately, she has experienced significant clinical deterioration over the past three weeks. Her CA125 has risen from 450 to 1200, and CT performed on 15/5/24 shows progressive disease with increasing omental cake and new peritoneal deposits. There is moderate volume ascites.

She is experiencing increasing abdominal pain requiring escalation of analgesia, with background MST increased to 30mg BD and breakthrough oxycodone usage increasing. Her appetite has significantly declined and she has lost 4kg in weight over 6 weeks. Performance status has declined to ECOG 2-3.

On examination today, there is marked abdominal distension with shifting dullness consistent with ascites. Tender palpable omental cake in right upper quadrant. No lower limb edema.

I have had a detailed discussion with [redacted name] and her daughter about disease progression. We have agreed to discontinue bevacizumab and consider second-line platinum-based chemotherapy once her performance status improves. She has been referred for urgent paracentesis.

	Further investigations
	1. Urgent paracentesis
	2. Repeat CA125 in 2 weeks

	Medication prescribed
	1. MST increased to 30mg BD
	2. Oxycodone 5mg PRN
	3. Metoclopramide 10mg TDS

	Follow up
	Urgent review in 2 weeks after paracentesis

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor renal function and electrolytes
	Please continue community support

cancer_timeline.value: CT shows progressive disease with increasing omental cake and new peritoneal deposits, moderate volume ascites
Discontinuing bevacizumab due to disease progression

patient_facts.value: Increasing abdominal pain requiring escalation of analgesia
Tender palpable omental cake in right upper quadrant, shifting dullness consistent with ascites, no lower limb edema
Lost 4kg in weight over 6 weeks with declining appetite

status_updates.value: High grade serous carcinoma of fallopian tube showing disease progression after first-line therapy. Significant clinical deterioration with symptomatic ascites and declining performance status
Disease progression on bevacizumab with rising CA125 and new peritoneal disease on imaging
Discontinuing bevacizumab, plan for second-line platinum-based chemotherapy once performance status improves
Deterioration in performance status to ECOG 2-3 with increasing symptom burden
Urgent paracentesis and repeat CA125 in 2 weeks
Urgent review in 2 weeks after paracentesis
